Food is like fuel for our bodies. We need different kinds of food to help us feel good and have lots of energy. Fruits and vegetables are like superheroes that help keep us healthy. Protein from meat, eggs, and beans helps build our muscles. And carbohydrates from bread, pasta, and rice give us energy to run and play. Eating a balanced diet means we get a little bit of everything our bodies need. It's like putting the right ingredients in a recipe to make a delicious and healthy meal.

Here is a paragraph about 'nutrition' at the Early Elementary level.
Nutrition is what we eat to stay healthy. Our bodies need food to have energy to run, play and learn. Food has three main parts: carbohydrates, proteins and fats. Carbohydrates are like the fuel for our cars. They give us energy to move. Fruits, vegetables, bread and pasta are all carbohydrates. Proteins help build and fix our bodies. They help us grow strong muscles and bones. Chicken, fish, beans and eggs are all proteins. Fats help us stay warm and keep our bodies healthy. Nuts, seeds and avocados are all fats. We need a little bit of everything to be healthy. Eating too much of one kind of food can make us sick. We should try to eat a variety of foods to get all the nutrients our bodies need. Eating right is like giving our bodies the tools they need to stay healthy and strong.
